event.title: became the first resident of what is today

data.event: In 1845, Nathan H. Strong (1813â€“1852) became the first resident of what is today Berlin.
In 1848 a post office was established.

event.title: was named Berlin after the capital of Prussia, now

data.event: It was named Berlin after the capital of Prussia, now the capital of Germany.
The first school house was built in 1850 and the first church in 1851.

event.title: was incorporated as a city in 1857

data.event: Berlin was incorporated as a city in 1857.
